column2: VIRGINIA DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. This road sign means:
2. This sign indicates that the road ahead:
3. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a double curve ahead.
column6: they must turn either to the right or left.
column10: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 4. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a double curve ahead.
column6: there is a winding road ahead.
column8: there is a low place in the road.
column10: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.

column2: 5. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column6: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column10: another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column8: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right

column2: 7. This road sign means:
8. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column4: go back and wait the “WALK” light

column2: 9. This traffic sign warns you about:
column10: a hill or a downgrade up ahead on the road.

column2: 10. The octagonal shape is used:
column4: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.
column6: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.

column2: 11. Braking distance is affected by:
column6: the condition of your brakes and tires.
column8: the speed your vehicle is traveling.

column2: 12. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
column10: Before you decrease speed and reach the intersection.

column2: 13. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column4: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.
column8: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.
column10: Not if they are licensed bicyclists.

column2: 14. DMV can deny or suspend driving privileges for persons under 18 if the person is found:
column4: involved in an alcohol or drug-related offense.

column2: 15. Searching does not include:
column6: checking from left to right and then left again before entering an intersection.
column8: trying to find your car in a parking lot.
column10: actively looking hazards on the road.

column2: 16. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: move as far away from traffic as possible.
column6: always park on the left side of the roadway.
column8: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.

column2: 17. Turn signals should be used when:
18. When changing lanes, you should not:
column4: use the inside rearview mirror to check for blind spots
column8: check your side and rear view mirrors.
column10: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.

column2: 19. Passing is prohibited:
column6: whenever a solid line marks the left side of your lane.
column8: when a school bus is stopped to load or unload children on a public road.

column2: 20. How many passengers may travel with a 16 year old driver?
21. Drivers entering an interstate highway from an entrance ramp must:
column4: yield to traffic already on the highway.
column10: turn around if another vehicle is in the lane.

column2: 22. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column6: The use of headlight is required by law.

column2: 23. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column6: look at your interior rear-view mirror.
column8: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.

column2: 24. In Virginia it is illegal to avoid traffic signals, signs and pavement markings by cutting through a parking lot or field.
25. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.
column6: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.

column2: 26. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column6: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.
column10: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.

column2: 27. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
28. BAC is:
column6: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.
column8: the amount of alcohol in your body.
column10: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 29. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column8: even if they are short sighted.

column2: 30. If under age 21, you can be convicted of illegal consumption of alcohol:
column4: if your BAC is .08 or higher.
column6: if your BAC is at least .02 but less than .08.
column8: if you had at more than 2 beers.

column2: 31. The driver is responsible for making sure that children are properly secured when riding.
32. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
column6: the driver who was going faster before stopping must yield.
column8: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
column10: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.

column2: 33. You must pull over to the edge of the road and allow an emergency vehicle to pass:
column4: only if the emergency vehicle is following you.
column6: only if the emergency vehicle is approaching.

column2: 34. Parking is not allowed:
column4: within 15 feet of a fire hydrant.
column8: within 50 feet of a railroad crossing.

column2: 35. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.
column6: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.
column8: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.

column2: 36. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
37. Zero tolerance is:
column4: how many times you can exceed the posted speed limit.
column6: a law that makes it illegal for youth under 21 to drive with a blood alcohol content of .02 or higher.
column8: a police officer asking you to take a blood alcohol test.

column2: 38. Your BAC depends on:
column4: how much time passes between drinks.

column2: 39. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column10: before the traffic light turns red.

column2: 40. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column4: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.
column8: wait until the crossing gates are completely up.
